remarks: Lemma for ~ stoweid .  This lemma is used to prove the statement abs( f(t) - g(t) ) < 2 epsilon, in the last step of the proof in [BrosowskiDeutsh] p. 92.  (Contributed by Glauco Siliprandi, 20-Apr-2017.)
statement:
stoweidlem13.1 $e |- ( ph -> E e. RR+ ) $.
stoweidlem13.2 $e |- ( ph -> X e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem13.3 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem13.4 $e |- ( ph -> j e. RR ) $.
stoweidlem13.5 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( j - ( 4 / 3 ) ) x. E ) < X ) $.
stoweidlem13.6 $e |- ( ph -> X <_ ( ( j - ( 1 / 3 ) ) x. E ) ) $.
stoweidlem13.7 $e |- ( ph -> ( ( j - ( 4 / 3 ) ) x. E ) < Y ) $.
stoweidlem13.8 $e |- ( ph -> Y < ( ( j + ( 1 / 3 ) ) x. E ) ) $.
stoweidlem13 $p |- ( ph -> ( abs ` ( Y - X ) ) < ( 2 x. E ) ) $.
